title: Summitt's Fundamentals of Operative Dentistry (4th Ed)(gnv64)
description:
Summitt's Fundamentals of Operative Dentistry (4th Ed)
by Thomas J. Hilton, Jack L. Ferracane, James Broome
Quintessence | October 2013 | ISBN-10: 0867155280 | PDF | 612 pages | 25.4 mb 
http://s17.postimg.org/ydowcuqqn/Summitt_s_Fundamentals_of_Operative_Dentistry_4.jpg

Over the past two decades, the Fundamentals of Operative Dentistry has become one of the most trusted textbooks on clinical restorative dentistry. By integrating time-tested methods with recent scientific innovation, the authors promote sound concepts for predictable conservative techniques. Now in its fourth edition, this classic text has been completely updated with full-color illustrations throughout and substantial revisions in every chapter to incorporate the latest scientific developments and current research findings. In addition, a new chapters on color study and shade matching address new areas of focus in the preclinical curriculum. A valuable resource for understanding the scientific basis for current treatment options in dentistry.

CONTENTS
In Memoriam
Preface
Contributors
1.Biologic Considerations
2.Patient Evaluation and Problem-Oriented Treatment Planning
3.Esthetic Considerations in Diagnosis and Treatment Planning
4.Color and Shade Matching
5.Caries Management: Diagnosis and Treatment Strategies
6.Pulpal Considerations
7.Nomenclature and Instrumentation
8.Field Isolation
9.Adhesion to Enamel and Dentin
10.Direct Anterior Restorations
11.Direct Posterior Esthetic Restorations
12.Amalgam Restorations
13.Diagnosis and Treatment of Root Caries
14.Fluoride-Releasing Materials
15.Class 5 Restorations
16.Natural Tooth Bleaching
17.Porcelain Veneers
18.Anterior Ceramic Crowns
19.Esthetic Inlays and Onlays
20.Cast Gold Restorations
21.Restoration of Endodontically Treated Teeth
